channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo

item.title: Live Updates: Hospitals Are Hit in Israeli Strikes, Gazan Officials Say
item.description: The attacks came as Israeli forces fought in northern Gaza, where emergency workers said dozens had been killed in bombardments overnight. Cease-fire ...

item.title: Amazon employees gripe about their work culture on social media
item.description: “Instead of the exciting, fast-paced environment I remember, I experienced a place bogged down in pointless meetings and middling middle managers.”

item.title: In Gaza, Sinwar’s Death Alone Won’t Secure the Peace
item.description: Even with Sinwar gone, I’m doubtful Hamas will fold or that Israel will easily embrace Biden’s ideas for a peace deal.

item.title: Novelty Acts
item.description: We’re so accustomed to researching, planning and curating every millisecond of our lives that we rarely stop to consider the mental cost.

item.title: What went wrong at CVS? Departing CEO Karen Lynch’s reign started brilliantly, then unraveled fast
item.description: A trifecta of problems, some that started before she took the top job, ended the reign of one of the most powerful women in American business.

item.title: American Business Cannot Afford to Risk Another Trump Presidency
item.description: Donald Trump is not running as a champion of business. He is running as a tribune of populist grievance.

item.title: Appian’s CEO walked away from millions—twice—but the risk paid off: Now he’s now worth over $4 billion.
item.description: He even convinced his four co-founders to turn down $200 million

item.description: The Catholic Church’s latest scandal: fawning over Donald.

item.title: Gen Z teens feel crushing pressure to achieve. 6 ways parents can fight it, not fuel it
item.description: “Achievement is not the problem,” says one expert. “It’s the way that we’ve come to talk about achievement.”
